image.altText: An AI-generated image of two people in a cafe.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is being used to generate child abuse material, and police are increasingly worried about its spread. But AI may also be able to help investigators.

title.children: This image is AI generated. It's innocent, but there are others police are very worried about

image.altText: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel holding up cross shared by Christ the Good Shepherd Church with audio graphic below

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel says he has forgiven "whoever has done this act" and calls for his community to not retaliate.

title.children: 'I will always pray for you': Stabbed Sydney bishop forgives attacker and calls for calm

image.altText: A red tailed black cockatoo and musk lorikeet at a wildlife sanctuary

props.synopsis: A red-tailed black cockatoo and a musk lorikeet have become inseparable, with the smaller bird often found under the wing of the cockatoo at Tasmania's Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary.

title.children: Unlikely friendship between cockatoo and lorikeet 'bamboozles' wildlife sanctuary visitors

image.altText: Amy, a woman with blonde hair, looks serious in a portrait.

props.synopsis: HECS-HELP debts are forecast to rise between 4.2 and 4.8 per cent this year, the second-highest rise in a decade.

title.children: 'Leave my hopes, dreams and country behind': Desperate HECS debtors brace for another large increase

image.altText: Two woman walk along a path in front of the beach, one of them is pushing a pram.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence support workers could be in Australia's future if the fertility rate continues to stay the same.

title.children: There's a baby drought in Australia. Here's why you should care

image.altText: Paramedics stand with stretches near vehicles on a road.

props.synopsis: Hospitals prepare for mass casualty events. At Sydney's St Vincent's hospital, they had to enact that plan on Saturday — this is how they handled the situation.

title.children: Repeated resuscitation was needed to keep Bondi stabbing victims alive

image.altText: Soldiers in camouflage parade holding guns

props.synopsis: Britain's foreign minister says it is clear that Israel is making a decision to act against Iran for its unprecedented strike on its territory.

title.children: Israel 'making a decision to act' against Iran, as Tehran warns of 'fierce and severe response'

image.altText: UQ researchers Professor Xiwang Zhang (L) and Dr Zhuyuan Wang

props.synopsis: It's hoped the nano-generator will eventually become a new method of industrial carbon capture with the potential to significantly reduce global carbon dioxide emissions.

title.children: Queensland researchers build device that creates electricity by consuming CO2

image.altText: A young woman faces another person, holding her hands and mouth in movement, as if in conversation.

props.synopsis: Author Charles Duhigg and broadcaster Beverley Wang have made a profession out of having good conversations. They share how deeper listening, laughing more, and slowing down can help.

title.children: The simple skills that can help you have deeper conversations

image.altText: A blurred imagine of two young people sitting together

props.synopsis: A family is in mourning following the death by suicide of a 10-year-old boy who was under the WA government's care. WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: Family in mourning after 10-year-old boy dies by suicide while under the WA government's care

image.altText: An aerial shot of a stretch of tropical coastline.

props.synopsis: Police report a 16-year-old boy tried to swim to Saibai Island from a broken-down dinghy after his younger friend made it to shore and raised the alarm.

title.children: Teenager missing in Torres Strait after boat breaks down during overnight trip

image.altText: A small brown mushroom sprouts from dark green grass

props.synopsis: The death of a Melbourne woman after consuming a drink made with mushrooms has prompted fresh warnings against the use of mushrooms as medicines without proper expertise and cautions against mushroom foraging.

title.children: What you should know about the potential harms of consuming 'magic' and foraged mushrooms

image.altText: Ron Ben-David in power price graphic

props.synopsis: For a decade, he regulated the energy industry in one of Australia's biggest states. Now Ron Ben-David is alarmed by the rise of complex, and often punishing, power tariffs.

title.children: Former energy watchdog alarmed by rise of 'incomprehensible' market and power prices

image.altText: Harry in a suit exits a car.

props.synopsis: Prince Harry's lawyer says he may be "forced" to settle a lawsuit against the publisher of Rupert Murdoch's tabloid newspaper The Sun after British actor Hugh Grant agreed on a deal.

title.children: Prince Harry may have to settle Murdoch lawsuit after Hugh Grant deal, his lawyer says

image.altText: A woman in shorts crouched down

props.synopsis: An ancient sport shrouded in mystery, professional sumo wrestling in Japan is reserved only for men. A group of young female warriors wants to change that.

title.children: Hiyori lives two lives. By day, she's an office worker but by night, she's a much-feared sumo warrior

image.altText: A composite image showing the Bondi Junction attacker and a screengrab of the livestream which captured the attack in Wakely.

props.synopsis: Two horrific attacks in Sydney have sparked debate over what defines an ideologically motivated attack, and whether deliberately targeting women should count as an act of terror.

title.children: Both Sydney stabbing attacks were violent and caused fear. Only one was deemed a terror incident

image.altText: A tall smiling man puts his arm round a shorter woman who leans against him grinning.

props.synopsis: James Barella had no ID on him when he died in a unicycle accident. His mother is calling on the government to regulate e-vehicle ownership and make safety restrictions.

title.children: 'They won't be banned, but we need to regulate them': A grieving family's fight to bolster Australia's e-vehicle rules

image.altText: Two men hug at a tennis net on an orange clay court.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur defeats Rafael Nadal in straight sets in what was the Spanish legend's farewell to the Barcelona Open.

title.children: 'At least I had the chance to say goodbye': Nadal farewells his Barcelona fans after straight sets loss to De Minaur

image.altText: A crowd of people bathed in red light stand in a street at night.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been charged by NSW Police in connection with a riot that happened after the alleged stabbing of a bishop inside a church in Sydney's south-west on Monday night. More arrests are expected.

title.children: First person arrested and charged in connection with riot that followed alleged Sydney church stabbing

image.altText: A woman standing near a flower memorial at Bondi Junction.

props.synopsis: The violence that unfolded in Westfield Bondi Junction has left women around Australia shaken and disturbed, leading to a spike in demand for some domestic violence services.

title.children: DV services getting more calls from women after Saturday's Bondi Junction attack

image.altText: smoking generic

props.synopsis: British politicians are working to pass a law similar to one introduced to Tasmanian parliament in 2015 that would have banned the sale of tobacco to people born after January 1, 2000.

title.children: The UK is a step closer to banning cigarettes for younger generations. Could it happen in Australia as well?

image.altText: A composite image of three historical buildings, hills and clouds

props.synopsis: On Tasmania's wild west coast, towns have risen and fallen at the whim of industry. Some of their oldest living inhabitants remember their former homes, and how their communities came undone.

title.children: Tasmania is riddled with hundreds of fading and vanishing towns. Where did they go wrong?

image.altText: Commuter holding a blue Go Card in front of a "tap on" station.

props.synopsis: The cards used by public transport commuters in South East Queensland for well over a decade will be phased out and replaced with a new fare card system — but Translink is yet to determine when.

title.children: Queensland's go card to be scrapped, replaced with new public transport fare pass

image.altText: Zendaya stands against a photo wall for Challengers in a green glittery dress with an outline of a tennis player and ball.

props.synopsis: Luca Guadagnino's newest film takes the majestic back-and-forth of professional tennis to hyper-erotic heights.

title.children: Zendaya says her character in new tennis movie Challengers should 'probably go to therapy'

image.altText: Yuja Wang plays a grand piano in front of an orchestra in a sparky red dress. Her right arm is thrown up dramatically.

props.synopsis: New York's famous Carnegie Hall tracked musician and audience heart rates during a live performance. The results show how in sync music can make us.

title.children: What tracking heart rates during a marathon concert tells us about the power of music

image.altText: A man in a blue football jumper kicks a yellow Aussie Rules ball, as a teammate watches on

props.synopsis: Six people including former Bulldog Zephaniah Skinner and prominent local traditional owner Rosita Shaw face court in Fitzroy Crossing charged with breaching alcohol carriage restrictions.

title.children: Former AFL player among six charged in Kimberley alcohol crackdown

image.altText: A close up of fidgeting hands. In the background, a psychologist watches on, taking notes.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the Bondi Junction stabbings, the Prime Minister says the government "could always do more" to address Australia's mental health crisis. It comes just a month after psychiatrists asked the government for more support.

title.children: Psychiatrists call for more investment in Australia's mental health workforce

image.altText: A group of police officers walk down a street in front of a shop front at night

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is investing hundreds of millions of dollars into bolstering the police force to deal with crime, particularly in Alice Springs. But will more police officers lead to less crime?

title.children: Does more police lead to less crime? Experts say there's more to it

image.altText: A gif shows a montage of four images

props.synopsis: Death defying stunts to celebrate Eid, Sumo throwing each other about by their loincloths, Thailand's famous and fun water festival — here's a snapshot at the happenings across our region.

title.children: Here's what's been happening in our region in 20 pictures

image.altText: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) shortly after the opening bell in New York, U.S.

props.synopsis: The benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses taking it 4 per cent off its recent record high, although gains in iron ore are expected to push the ASX higher. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Wall St posts fourth day of losses as investors weigh higher-for-longer rate risks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Early gains for the ASX as miners and banks lift
AUSTRAC hits businesses with infringement notices for not meeting obligations
BHP to decide on future of Nickel West by August

image.altText: A surgeon wearing a plastic face mask and scrubs refills an injection with vaccines

props.synopsis: The discrimination and bullying reported by non-binary trainee doctors in the latest Medical Training Survey is double the average for their male and female peers, and they are more likely to be considering dropping out.

title.children: Non-binary doctors report more discrimination and harassment

image.altText: a woman looks at the camera from a wheelchair

props.synopsis: NDIS users facing unpaid bills and deteriorating mental health due to months-long funding delays call for more compassion and less complexity in the system.

title.children: When her NDIS payments stopped for months, Becki turned to her own savings to pay for vital services

image.altText: Collage of music biopic portrayals of Bob Marley, John Lennon, Amy Winehouse, Elvis Presley and Freddie Mercury

props.synopsis: Cinema's depictions of musicians are increasingly sanitised. But box office successes Bohemian Rhapsody and Bob Marley suggest that's what we want.

title.children: Music biopics are the latest film cash cow — here's why we're seeing so many of them
